pr_title: [1.0.x] FAI-293 - Update trusty readme with clarification

timeline.bodyText: the default checkout branch is stable though. Isn't this a clarification that applies to the entire repo?
timeline.author: evacchi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2,6 +2,10 @@
 
 This is a demonstration of the trusty AI tracing capabilities. 
 
+NOTE: the master branch is aligned to the latest changes in all the repositories. This means that master might be using some new operator features not included in the latest release of the operator. 
+In order to play with the demo, remember to checkout the branch of the release your are using. For example, if the version of the kogito release is `1.0.0`, 
+you have to checkout this repository to the branch `1.0.x`.

replies.bodyText:
Hi @evacchi , yeah you're right. I should remark to checkout stable instead of the target release branch, wdyt?
I think the "issue" here is that we declare what is the version of kogito operator for the demo (for example 0.17), and of course master might contain new features that are not on 0.17. This messes up the demo and by construction it might be "broken" on master.
The other examples on master are running fine since they are using snapshot and not a specific version of kogito. It's already pretty clear in the root README with the sentence Default branch is stable, pointing to the latest released version.
replies.author: r00ta
